UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user profile on the Golden Enclave platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserProfile entity.

displayName.description: The user's display name (can be different from username).

bio.description: A short biography or description of the user.

profilePictureUrl.description: URL of the user's profile picture.

isCreator.description: Indicates whether the user is a content creator.

Content.title: Content
Content.description: Represents a piece of content created by a creator.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Content entity.

creatorId.description: Reference to Creator's UserProfile. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Content)

description.description: A brief description of the content.

contentUrl.description: URL of the content (e.g., video, audio, text).

uploadDate.description: The date and time when the content was uploaded.

contentType.description: The type of content (e.g., video, audio, text).

Subscription.title: Subscription
Subscription.description: Represents a user's subscription to a creator's content.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Subscription entity.

subscriberId.description: Reference to the subscribing UserProfile. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Subscription)

creatorId.description: Reference to the creator's UserProfile. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Subscription)

subscriptionDate.description: The date and time when the user subscribed.

expirationDate.description: The date and time when the subscription expires.

subscriptionLevelId.description: Reference to SubscriptionLevel entity. (Relationship: SubscriptionLevel 1:N Subscription)

paymentMethod.description: The payment method used for the subscription (e.g., Coinbase Commerce, Stripe).

SubscriptionLevel.title: SubscriptionLevel
SubscriptionLevel.description: Represents different tiers of subscription levels.

id.description: Unique identifier for the SubscriptionLevel entity.

levelName.description: The name of the subscription level (e.g., Basic, Premium, VIP).

description.description: A description of the benefits included in this subscription level.

price.description: The price of the subscription level.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents an encrypted direct message between a creator and a subscriber.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Message entity.

senderId.description: Reference to UserProfile of the sender. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Message)

recipientId.description: Reference to UserProfile of the recipient. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Message)

messageText.description: The encrypted text of the message.

timestamp.description: The date and time when the message was sent.

isRead.description: Indicates whether the message has been read by the recipient.

Recommendation.title: Recommendation
Recommendation.description: Represents a content or creator recommendation for a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Recommendation entity.

userId.description: Reference to the UserProfile. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Recommendation)

contentId.description: Reference to recommended Content (can be null if recommending a creator). (Relationship: Content 1:N Recommendation)

creatorId.description: Reference to recommended Creator (can be null if recommending content). (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Recommendation)

reason.description: The reason for the recommendation (e.g., subscription history, similar content).

timestamp.description: The date and time when the recommendation was generated.

definition.description: Stores user profile information. Secured by user ID. Includes denormalized data, if required, for authorization in subcollections.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique ID of the user.

definition.description: Stores content created by users. Secured by user ID and creatorId in the content document.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique ID of the user (creator).

params.name: contentId
params.description: The unique ID of the content.

definition.description: Stores subscription information. Access control is based on subscriberId and creatorId.

params.name: subscriptionId
params.description: The unique ID of the subscription.

params.name: subscriptionLevelId
params.description: The unique ID of the subscription level.

definition.description: Stores direct messages between creators and subscribers. Secured by senderId and recipientId within the message. The 'userId' path parameter should match either the senderId or recipientId in the message.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique ID of the user (sender or recipient).

params.name: messageId
params.description: The unique ID of the message.

definition.description: Stores content and creator recommendations for users. Secured by userId.

params.name: recommendationId
params.description: The unique ID of the recommendation.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to support a creator-driven content subscription platform. It prioritizes authorization independence by denormalizing authorization data, ensuring that security rules can be evaluated without complex `get()` calls. The structure also supports secure `list` operations via structural segregation. User profiles, content, subscriptions, subscription levels, messages, and recommendations are structured into collections with clear ownership and access patterns.

Specifically, Authorization Independence is achieved through path-based ownership for UserProfile and Content. Access to content is controlled by the creatorId field within the Content document, which maps back to a UserProfile. Messages are stored in a subcollection under user profiles for direct messaging, with sender and recipient information contained within each message, eliminating the need to traverse to other collections for validation. Subscriptions are stored at `/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}`. QAPs are ensured via path-based ownership and structural segregation; for instance, listing content is restricted to content created by the currently authenticated user when under their profile.

This design allows for simple and robust security rules based on `request.auth.uid` and document data, which enhances debuggability and scalability. Timestamps are included in relevant entities (Content, Subscription, Message, Recommendation) to support ordering and filtering of data.
